column4: I'm using the kubuntu 9.04 live cd.  I just installed the nvidia proprietary driver, and the system wants a reboot to activate it.  Is there any way around this?
no
the graphics card driver shoudn't be installed on the Live CD, since you  need to reboot really, unless you can just log out and back in again
log out and back in on a live cd?
maybe possible somehow
I think I have seen log in screen on Ubuntu Live CD's before
well there's a way in Wine
yeah got to use a Windows browser as well or something,  I remember reading something in the past
well sure Launchpad I guess
unless you know their IRC nicks,  but they probably won't want to just be pm'd by anyone
What is Software Centre?  Experimental package manager?
no
its the program that replaced the old add/remove starting with 9.10
Fishscene: What's the actual command to invoke it via CLI?
Fishscene:  I'm on 10.04
Every application has to reside somewhere, usually in /usr/sbin, /usr/bin, somewhere.
Incidentally, are we talking kde?
no
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SoftwareCenter
thanks
The CLI command to invoke Software Centre is:  software-center
